content:

On November 20, Chaozhou City issued a notice, announcing the launch of fire safety, environmental protection and sanitation assessments in preparation for the "national exam". If the company itself fails to meet the standards, production will be suspended for a few days. If found, a fine of 50,000 yuan will be imposed.
As a result, after the notice was issued, a large number of shops and companies in Chaozhou City directly closed their doors and refused to be inspected.
As a result, Chaozhou issued another urgent notice one day later, requiring companies and shops not to deliberately close their doors and refuse to be inspected without legitimate reasons.

content: On October 27, a conflict broke out at the resettlement housing handover site at Longxiyuan in Zhangzhishan Town, Nantong, Jiangsu Province. The property management company demanded a 1,000 yuan deposit regardless of whether the house was renovated or not, and would not give the keys if the deposit was not paid.
